appointment-type.title: --WELSH What would you like to discuss?

options.hint: --WELSH Explains the options for taking money from your defined contribution pension.
--WELSH Divorce and dissolution can be complicated and stressful. Getting impartial guidance from us can make managing your pension options easier.
--WELSH Speak to a pensions specialist if you are self-employed and need help understanding your pension options.
--WELSH For people who have lost pension money due to a scam or fraud and need support.

radio-button.error: --WELSH Select what type of appointment you would like.

sections.content: --WELSH A free Pension Wise appointment explains the options for taking money from your defined contribution pension. It’s impartial and backed by government.

items: --WELSH when you can access your pension pots
--WELSH the different ways you can take money from your pension
--WELSH how each option is usually taxed
--WELSH how to spot and avoid scams.

sections.content: --WELSH You can’t book a Pension Wise appointment if:
items: --WELSH you only have a defined benefit pension (final salary or career-average salary) or
--WELSH you only have an overseas pension.

eligibility-defined-contribution.title: --WELSH Do you have a defined contribution pension?

sections.content: --WELSH This is the type of pension where you or your employer pay into a pot, and its value can go up or down depending on investments. You can use our tool to [find out your pension type (opens in a new tab)](https://tool.moneyhelper.org.uk/en/pension-type/question-1).

radio-button.label: --WELSH Do you have a defined contribution pension?

options.text: --WELSH No, I have a different type of pension

radio-button.error: --WELSH Please select whether you have a defined contribution pension.

radio-button.label: --WELSH Are you aged 50 or over?
radio-button.error: --WELSH Please select whether you are over 50 years old

eligibility-uk-pensions.title: --WELSH Do you have any pensions based in the UK?

sections.content: --WELSH You can book an appointment if you have at least one UK-based pension. For example, a pension you built up while working or living in the UK.

radio-button.label: --WELSH Do you have any pensions based in the UK?
radio-button.error: --WELSH Please select whether you only have an overseas pension

eligibility-age-exceptions.title: --WELSH Do any of the following apply to you?

radio-button.label: --WELSH Do any of the following apply to you?

options.text: --WELSH You have inherited someone else’s pension
--WELSH You are retiring early due to poor health
--WELSH Your pension scheme allows early access (protected pension age)

radio-button.error: --WELSH Please select whether any of the options apply to you

pension-wise-not-eligible.title: --WELSH You’re not eligible for a Pension Wise appointment

sections.content: --WELSH You can’t book a Pension Wise appointment if:
items: --WELSH you only have a defined benefit pension (final salary or career-average salary) or
--WELSH you only have an overseas pension.

sections.content: --WELSH We can still help if you’re not eligible for Pension Wise. You can contact our pension specialists for free guidance:
--WELSH We’re open between 9am and 5pm, Monday to Friday. Closed on bank holidays.
--WELSH You can also use our [pension guides and tools.](#)

--WELSH Speak to someone who can help book your free appointment on [0800 138 3944](tel:08001383944) or use our [webchat](https://webchat.moneyhelper.org.uk/newchat/chat.aspx?domain=www.moneyhelper.org.uk).

Call between 8am to 6:30pm, Monday to Friday.
